-- Autocmds are automatically loaded on the VeryLazy event
-- Default autocmds that are always set: https://github.com/LazyVim/LazyVim/blob/main/lua/lazyvim/config/autocmds.lua
--
-- Add any additional autocmds here

Content from @dot_config/nvim/lua/config/lazy.lua:
local lazypath = vim.fn.stdpath(&#34;data&#34;) .. &#34;/lazy/lazy.nvim&#34;
if not (vim.uv or vim.loop).fs_stat(lazypath) then
  local lazyrepo = &#34;https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git&#34;
  local out = vim.fn.system({ &#34;git&#34;, &#34;clone&#34;, &#34;--filter=blob:none&#34;, &#34;--branch=stable&#34;, lazyrepo, lazypath })
  if vim.v.shell_error ~= 0 then
    vim.api.nvim_echo({
      { &#34;Failed to clone lazy.nvim:\n&#34;, &#34;ErrorMsg&#34; },
      { out, &#34;WarningMsg&#34; },
      { &#34;\nPress any key to exit...&#34; },
    }, true, {})
    vim.fn.getchar()
    os.exit(1)
  end
end
vim.opt.rtp:prepend(lazypath)

require(&#34;lazy&#34;).setup({
  spec = {
    -- add LazyVim and import its plugins
    { &#34;LazyVim/LazyVim&#34;, import = &#34;lazyvim.plugins&#34; },
    -- import/override with your plugins
    { import = &#34;plugins&#34; },
  },
  defaults = {
    -- By default, only LazyVim plugins will be lazy-loaded. Your custom plugins will load during startup.
    -- If you know what you&#39;re doing, you can set this to `true` to have all your custom plugins lazy-loaded by default.
    lazy = false,
    -- It&#39;s recommended to leave version=false for now, since a lot the plugin that support versioning,
    -- have outdated releases, which may break your Neovim install.
    version = false, -- always use the latest git commit
    -- version = &#34;*&#34;, -- try installing the latest stable version for plugins that support semver
  },
  install = { colorscheme = { &#34;tokyonight&#34;, &#34;habamax&#34; } },
  checker = {
    enabled = true, -- check for plugin updates periodically
    notify = false, -- notify on update
  }, -- automatically check for plugin updates
  performance = {
    rtp = {
      -- disable some rtp plugins
      disabled_plugins = {
        &#34;gzip&#34;,
        -- &#34;matchit&#34;,
        -- &#34;matchparen&#34;,
        -- &#34;netrwPlugin&#34;,
        &#34;tarPlugin&#34;,
        &#34;tohtml&#34;,
        &#34;tutor&#34;,
        &#34;zipPlugin&#34;,
      },
    },
  },
})

Content from @dot_config/nvim/lua/plugins/diffview.lua:
local function toggle_diffview(cmd)
  if next(require(&#34;diffview.lib&#34;).views) == nil then
    vim.cmd(cmd)
  else
    vim.cmd(&#34;DiffviewClose&#34;)
  end
end

return {
  &#34;sindrets/diffview.nvim&#34;,
  command = &#34;DiffviewOpen&#34;,
  cond = is_git_root,
  keys = {
    {
      &#34;&lt;leader&gt;gd&#34;,
      function()
        toggle_diffview(&#34;DiffviewOpen&#34;)
      end,
      desc = &#34;Diff Index&#34;,
    },
    {
      &#34;&lt;leader&gt;gD&#34;,
      function()
        toggle_diffview(&#34;DiffviewOpen master..HEAD&#34;)
      end,
      desc = &#34;Diff master&#34;,
    },
    {
      &#34;&lt;leader&gt;gf&#34;,
      function()
        toggle_diffview(&#34;DiffviewFileHistory %&#34;)
      end,
      desc = &#34;Open diffs for current File&#34;,
    },
  },
}
Content from @dot_config/nvim/lua/plugins/example.lua:
-- since this is just an example spec, don&#39;t actually load anything here and return an empty spec
-- stylua: ignore
if true then return {} end

-- every spec file under the &#34;plugins&#34; directory will be loaded automatically by lazy.nvim
--
-- In your plugin files, you can:
-- * add extra plugins
-- * disable/enabled LazyVim plugins
-- * override the configuration of LazyVim plugins
return {
  -- add gruvbox
  { &#34;ellisonleao/gruvbox.nvim&#34; },

  -- Configure LazyVim to load gruvbox
  {
    &#34;LazyVim/LazyVim&#34;,
    opts = {
      colorscheme = &#34;gruvbox&#34;,
    },
  },

  -- change trouble config
  {
    &#34;folke/trouble.nvim&#34;,
    -- opts will be merged with the parent spec
    opts = { use_diagnostic_signs = true },
  },

  -- disable trouble
  { &#34;folke/trouble.nvim&#34;, enabled = false },

  -- override nvim-cmp and add cmp-emoji
  {
    &#34;hrsh7th/nvim-cmp&#34;,
    dependencies = { &#34;hrsh7th/cmp-emoji&#34; },
    ---@param opts cmp.ConfigSchema
    opts = function(_, opts)
      table.insert(opts.sources, { name = &#34;emoji&#34; })
    end,
  },

  -- change some telescope options and a keymap to browse plugin files
  {
    &#34;nvim-telescope/telescope.nvim&#34;,
    keys = {
      -- add a keymap to browse plugin files
      -- stylua: ignore
      {
        &#34;&lt;leader&gt;fp&#34;,
        function() require(&#34;telescope.builtin&#34;).find_files({ cwd = require(&#34;lazy.core.config&#34;).options.root }) end,
        desc = &#34;Find Plugin File&#34;,
      },
    },
    -- change some options
    opts = {
      defaults = {
        layout_strategy = &#34;horizontal&#34;,
        layout_config = { prompt_position = &#34;top&#34; },
        sorting_strategy = &#34;ascending&#34;,
        winblend = 0,
      },
    },
  },

  -- add pyright to lspconfig
  {
    &#34;neovim/nvim-lspconfig&#34;,
    ---@class PluginLspOpts
    opts = {
      ---@type lspconfig.options
      servers = {
        -- pyright will be automatically installed with mason and loaded with lspconfig
        pyright = {},
      },
    },
  },

  -- add tsserver and setup with typescript.nvim instead of lspconfig
  {
    &#34;neovim/nvim-lspconfig&#34;,
    dependencies = {
      &#34;jose-elias-alvarez/typescript.nvim&#34;,
      init = function()
        require(&#34;lazyvim.util&#34;).lsp.on_attach(function(_, buffer)
          -- stylua: ignore
          vim.keymap.set( &#34;n&#34;, &#34;&lt;leader&gt;co&#34;, &#34;TypescriptOrganizeImports&#34;, { buffer = buffer, desc = &#34;Organize Imports&#34; })
          vim.keymap.set(&#34;n&#34;, &#34;&lt;leader&gt;cR&#34;, &#34;TypescriptRenameFile&#34;, { desc = &#34;Rename File&#34;, buffer = buffer })
        end)
      end,
    },
    ---@class PluginLspOpts
    opts = {
      ---@type lspconfig.options
      servers = {
        -- tsserver will be automatically installed with mason and loaded with lspconfig
        tsserver = {},
      },
      -- you can do any additional lsp server setup here
      -- return true if you don&#39;t want this server to be setup with lspconfig
      ---@type table&lt;string, fun(server:string, opts:_.lspconfig.options):boolean?&gt;
      setup = {
        -- example to setup with typescript.nvim
        tsserver = function(_, opts)
          require(&#34;typescript&#34;).setup({ server = opts })
          return true
        end,
        -- Specify * to use this function as a fallback for any server
        -- [&#34;*&#34;] = function(server, opts) end,
      },
    },
  },

  -- for typescript, LazyVim also includes extra specs to properly setup lspconfig,
  -- treesitter, mason and typescript.nvim. So instead of the above, you can use:
  { import = &#34;lazyvim.plugins.extras.lang.typescript&#34; },

  -- add more treesitter parsers
  {
    &#34;nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter&#34;,
    opts = {
      ensure_installed = {
        &#34;bash&#34;,
        &#34;html&#34;,
        &#34;javascript&#34;,
        &#34;json&#34;,
        &#34;lua&#34;,
        &#34;markdown&#34;,
        &#34;markdown_inline&#34;,
        &#34;python&#34;,
        &#34;query&#34;,
        &#34;regex&#34;,
        &#34;tsx&#34;,
        &#34;typescript&#34;,
        &#34;vim&#34;,
        &#34;yaml&#34;,
      },
    },
  },

  -- since `vim.tbl_deep_extend`, can only merge tables and not lists, the code above
  -- would overwrite `ensure_installed` with the new value.
  -- If you&#39;d rather extend the default config, use the code below instead:
  {
    &#34;nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter&#34;,
    opts = function(_, opts)
      -- add tsx and treesitter
      vim.list_extend(opts.ensure_installed, {
        &#34;tsx&#34;,
        &#34;typescript&#34;,
      })
    end,
  },

  -- the opts function can also be used to change the default opts:
  {
    &#34;nvim-lualine/lualine.nvim&#34;,
    event = &#34;VeryLazy&#34;,
    opts = function(_, opts)
      table.insert(opts.sections.lualine_x, {
        function()
          return &#34;üòÑ&#34;
        end,
      })
    end,
  },

  -- or you can return new options to override all the defaults
  {
    &#34;nvim-lualine/lualine.nvim&#34;,
    event = &#34;VeryLazy&#34;,
    opts = function()
      return {
        --[[add your custom lualine config here]]
      }
    end,
  },

  -- use mini.starter instead of alpha
  { import = &#34;lazyvim.plugins.extras.ui.mini-starter&#34; },

  -- add jsonls and schemastore packages, and setup treesitter for json, json5 and jsonc
  { import = &#34;lazyvim.plugins.extras.lang.json&#34; },

  -- add any tools you want to have installed below
  {
    &#34;williamboman/mason.nvim&#34;,
    opts = {
      ensure_installed = {
        &#34;stylua&#34;,
        &#34;shellcheck&#34;,
        &#34;shfmt&#34;,
        &#34;flake8&#34;,
      },
    },
  },
}

Content from @dot_config/nvim/lua/plugins/nvim-cmp.lua:
-- https://www.reddit.com/r/neovim/comments/156c9nh/how_to_use_tab_to_confirm_first_autocomplete_in/
-- https://github.com/LazyVim/LazyVim/discussions/39#discussioncomment-6069716
-- https://www.lazyvim.org/configuration/recipes
-- https://www.reddit.com/r/neovim/comments/19054s4/help_how_do_i_auto_complete_with_tab_in_lazyvim/
-- https://github.com/hrsh7th/nvim-cmp/wiki/Example-mappings#intellij-like-mapping
-- https://github.com/LazyVim/LazyVim/discussions/250
return {
  {
    &#34;L3MON4D3/LuaSnip&#34;,
    keys = function()
      return {}
    end,
  },
  {
    &#34;hrsh7th/nvim-cmp&#34;,
    dependencies = {
      &#34;hrsh7th/cmp-emoji&#34;,
    },
    ---@param opts cmp.ConfigSchema
    opts = function(_, opts)
      local cmp = require(&#34;cmp&#34;)

      opts.mapping = vim.tbl_extend(&#34;force&#34;, opts.mapping, {
        [&#34;&lt;Tab&gt;&#34;] = cmp.mapping(function(fallback)
          -- This little snippet will confirm with tab, and if no entry is selected, will confirm the first item
          if cmp.visible() then
            local entry = cmp.get_selected_entry()
            if not entry then
              cmp.select_next_item({ behavior = cmp.SelectBehavior.Select })
            else
              cmp.confirm()
            end
          else
            fallback()
          end
        end, { &#34;i&#34;, &#34;s&#34; }),
      })
    end,
  },
}

Content from @dot_config/nvim/lua/sqlit_float/init.lua:
-- lua/sqlit_float/init.lua
local M = {}

---@class SqlitFloatConfig
---@field cmd string[]|string
---@field width number        -- 0~1
---@field height number       -- 0~1
---@field border string
---@field title string
---@field title_pos &#34;center&#34;|&#34;left&#34;|&#34;right&#34;
---@field winblend integer    -- 0~100
---@field persist boolean     -- keep terminal/job state between toggles
---@field close_key string    -- terminal-mode key to hide/close window, e.g. &#34;&lt;C-q&gt;&#34;
local default_config = {
  cmd = { &#34;sqlit&#34; },
  width = 0.9,
  height = 0.85,
  border = &#34;rounded&#34;,
  title = &#34; sqlit &#34;,
  title_pos = &#34;center&#34;,
  winblend = 0,
  persist = true,
  close_key = &#34;&lt;C-q&gt;&#34;,
}

local state = {
  buf = nil, ---@type integer|nil
  win = nil, ---@type integer|nil
  job = nil, ---@type integer|nil
  config = default_config,
}

local function is_valid_win(win)
  return win ~= nil and vim.api.nvim_win_is_valid(win)
end

local function is_valid_buf(buf)
  return buf ~= nil and vim.api.nvim_buf_is_valid(buf)
end

local function calc_win_config()
  local columns = vim.o.columns
  local lines = vim.o.lines

  local w = math.floor(columns * state.config.width)
  local h = math.floor(lines * state.config.height)
  if w &lt; 20 then
    w = 20
  end
  if h &lt; 5 then
    h = 5
  end

  local row = math.floor((lines - h) / 2 - 1)
  local col = math.floor((columns - w) / 2)
  if row &lt; 0 then
    row = 0
  end
  if col &lt; 0 then
    col = 0
  end

  return {
    relative = &#34;editor&#34;,
    width = w,
    height = h,
    row = row,
    col = col,
    style = &#34;minimal&#34;,
    border = state.config.border,
    title = state.config.title,
    title_pos = state.config.title_pos,
  }
end

local function ensure_buf()
  if is_valid_buf(state.buf) then
    return
  end

  state.buf = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, true) -- listed=false, scratch=true

  -- ‚ö†Ô∏è ‰∏çË¶ÅÊâãÂãïË®≠ buftype=terminalÔºåÊúÉ E474
  vim.bo[state.buf].swapfile = false
  vim.bo[state.buf].bufhidden = state.config.persist and &#34;hide&#34; or &#34;wipe&#34;
end

local function set_buf_keymaps()
  if not is_valid_buf(state.buf) then
    return
  end

  -- ‚úÖ Â§ñÂ±§ÊéßÂà∂ÈçµÔºöÁî® &lt;C-q&gt; Èö±Ëóè/ÈóúÈñâÔºåÈÅøÂÖçÊê∂Ëµ∞ sqlit ÁöÑ Esc / vim mode
  vim.keymap.set(&#34;t&#34;, state.config.close_key, function()
    M.close()
  end, { buffer = state.buf, silent = true, nowait = true, desc = &#34;Hide/close floating TUI&#34; })

  -- ‚úÖ ÈúÄË¶ÅÊôÇÈõ¢Èñã terminal-modeÔºöÁî®ÂÖßÂª∫ÁöÑ &lt;C-\&gt;&lt;C-n&gt;
  --Ôºà‰∏çÂÅöÊò†Â∞Ñ‰πüË°åÔºõÈÄôÊòØ nvim ÁöÑÈ†êË®≠Ë°åÁÇ∫Ôºâ
end

local function open_window()
  ensure_buf()

  local win = vim.api.nvim_open_win(state.buf, true, calc_win_config())
  state.win = win

  vim.wo[win].winblend = state.config.winblend
  vim.wo[win].number = false
  vim.wo[win].relativenumber = false
  vim.wo[win].signcolumn = &#34;no&#34;
  vim.wo[win].cursorline = false

  set_buf_keymaps()

  return win
end

local function start_job_if_needed()
  if state.job and state.job &gt; 0 then
    return
  end

  local cmd = state.config.cmd

  -- ËÆì jobstart({term=true}) attach Âà∞ÊàëÂÄëÁöÑ buffer
  vim.api.nvim_buf_call(state.buf, function()
    local job = vim.fn.jobstart(cmd, {
      term = true,
      on_exit = function()
        vim.schedule(function()
          state.job = nil
          -- job ÁµêÊùüÂ∞±Êää window ÈóúÊéâÔºõbuffer ÊòØÂê¶‰øùÁïôÁî± persist Ê±∫ÂÆö
          if is_valid_win(state.win) then
            pcall(vim.api.nvim_win_close, state.win, true)
          end
          state.win = nil

          if not state.config.persist then
            state.buf = nil
          end
        end)
      end,
    })

    if job &lt;= 0 then
      vim.notify(&#34;jobstart failed: &#34; .. tostring(job), vim.log.levels.ERROR)
      return
    end

    state.job = job
  end)
end

function M.open()
  if is_valid_win(state.win) then
    vim.api.nvim_set_current_win(state.win)
    return
  end

  open_window()
  start_job_if_needed()

  -- ÈÄ≤ÂÖ• terminal-modeÔºà‰∏çÁ∂Å EscÔºåÈÅøÂÖçË∑ü sqlit vim-mode Ë°ùÁ™ÅÔºâ
  vim.cmd(&#34;startinsert&#34;)
end

function M.close()
  if is_valid_win(state.win) then
    if state.config.persist then
      pcall(vim.api.nvim_win_hide, state.win) -- ‚úÖ Èö±ËóèÔºå‰øùÁïôÁãÄÊÖã
    else
      pcall(vim.api.nvim_win_close, state.win, true)
    end
  end
  state.win = nil

  if not state.config.persist then
    if state.job then
      pcall(vim.fn.jobstop, state.job)
    end
    state.job = nil
    if is_valid_buf(state.buf) then
      pcall(vim.api.nvim_buf_delete, state.buf, { force = true })
    end
    state.buf = nil
  end
end

function M.toggle()
  if is_valid_win(state.win) then
    M.close()
  else
    M.open()
  end
end

---@param cfg SqlitFloatConfig|nil
function M.setup(cfg)
  state.config = vim.tbl_deep_extend(&#34;force&#34;, {}, default_config, cfg or {})

  vim.api.nvim_create_user_command(&#34;SqlitFloatToggle&#34;, function()
    M.toggle()
  end, {})

  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(&#34;VimResized&#34;, {
    callback = function()
      if is_valid_win(state.win) then
        vim.api.nvim_win_set_config(state.win, calc_win_config())
      end
    end,
  })
end

return M
Content from @dot_config/nvim/lua/sqlit_float/init.lua.bak:
-- lua/sqlit_float/init.lua
local M = {}

---@class SqlitFloatConfig
---@field cmd string[]|string  -- {&#34;sqlit&#34;} or &#34;sqlit&#34;
---@field width number         -- 0~1 (ratio)
---@field height number        -- 0~1 (ratio)
---@field border string        -- &#34;rounded&#34; | &#34;single&#34; | ...
---@field title string
---@field title_pos string     -- &#34;center&#34; | &#34;left&#34; | &#34;right&#34;
---@field winblend integer     -- 0~100
local default_config = {
  cmd = { &#34;sqlit&#34; },
  width = 0.9,
  height = 0.85,
  border = &#34;rounded&#34;,
  title = &#34; sqlit &#34;,
  title_pos = &#34;center&#34;,
  winblend = 0,
}

local state = {
  buf = nil,
  win = nil,
  job = nil,
  config = default_config,
}

local function is_valid_win(win)
  return win and vim.api.nvim_win_is_valid(win)
end

local function is_valid_buf(buf)
  return buf and vim.api.nvim_buf_is_valid(buf)
end

local function calc_win_config()
  local columns = vim.o.columns
  local lines = vim.o.lines

  -- Áïô‰∏ÄÈªûÁ©∫ÈñìÈÅøÂÖçË≤ºÈÇä„ÄÅ‰πüÈÅøÈñã cmdline
  local w = math.floor(columns * state.config.width)
  local h = math.floor(lines * state.config.height)

  if w &lt; 20 then
    w = 20
  end
  if h &lt; 5 then
    h = 5
  end

  local row = math.floor((lines - h) / 2 - 1)
  local col = math.floor((columns - w) / 2)

  if row &lt; 0 then
    row = 0
  end
  if col &lt; 0 then
    col = 0
  end

  return {
    relative = &#34;editor&#34;,
    width = w,
    height = h,
    row = row,
    col = col,
    style = &#34;minimal&#34;,
    border = state.config.border,
    title = state.config.title,
    title_pos = state.config.title_pos,
  }
end

local function ensure_buf()
  if is_valid_buf(state.buf) then
    return
  end
  state.buf = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, true) -- listed=false, scratch=true
  -- vim.bo[state.buf].buftype = &#34;terminal&#34;
  vim.bo[state.buf].bufhidden = &#34;wipe&#34;
  vim.bo[state.buf].swapfile = false
end

local function open_window()
  ensure_buf()
  local win = vim.api.nvim_open_win(state.buf, true, calc_win_config())
  state.win = win

  -- Ë¶ñË¶∫ËàáË°åÁÇ∫
  vim.wo[win].winblend = state.config.winblend
  vim.wo[win].number = false
  vim.wo[win].relativenumber = false
  vim.wo[win].signcolumn = &#34;no&#34;
  vim.wo[win].cursorline = false

  -- Â∏∏Áî®Ôºöq / &lt;Esc&gt; ÈóúÈñâ
  vim.keymap.set(&#34;n&#34;, &#34;q&#34;, function()
    M.close()
  end, { buffer = state.buf, nowait = true, silent = true })
  vim.keymap.set(&#34;t&#34;, &#34;&lt;Esc&gt;&#34;, [[&lt;C-\&gt;&lt;C-n&gt;]], { buffer = state.buf, silent = true })
  vim.keymap.set(&#34;t&#34;, &#34;&lt;C-q&gt;&#34;, function()
    M.close()
  end, { buffer = state.buf, silent = true })

  return win
end

local function start_job()
  if state.job and state.job &gt; 0 then
    return
  end

  local cmd = state.config.cmd
  local ok, job = pcall(vim.fn.termopen, cmd, {
    on_exit = function()
      -- TUI ÁµêÊùüÊôÇËá™ÂãïÊääË¶ñÁ™óÈóúÊéâÔºà‰ΩÜ buffer ÊúÉ wipeÔºâ
      vim.schedule(function()
        state.job = nil
        if is_valid_win(state.win) then
          pcall(vim.api.nvim_win_close, state.win, true)
        end
        state.win = nil
        state.buf = nil
      end)
    end,
  })
  if ok then
    state.job = job
  else
    vim.notify(&#34;termopen failed: &#34; .. tostring(job), vim.log.levels.ERROR)
  end
end

function M.open()
  if is_valid_win(state.win) then
    vim.api.nvim_set_current_win(state.win)
    return
  end
  open_window()
  start_job()
  vim.cmd(&#34;startinsert&#34;)
end

function M.close()
  if is_valid_win(state.win) then
    pcall(vim.api.nvim_win_close, state.win, true)
  end
  state.win = nil

  -- ‰∏çÂº∑ÊÆ∫ jobÔºàËÆì sqlit Ëá™Â∑±ÈÄÄÂá∫ÔºâÔºõ‰Ω†‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ÊîπÊàêÂº∑ÊÆ∫Ôºö
  -- if state.job then pcall(vim.fn.jobstop, state.job) end
  -- state.job = nil

  if is_valid_buf(state.buf) then
    pcall(vim.api.nvim_buf_delete, state.buf, { force = true })
  end
  state.buf = nil
end

function M.toggle()
  if is_valid_win(state.win) then
    M.close()
  else
    M.open()
  end
end

---@param cfg SqlitFloatConfig|nil
function M.setup(cfg)
  state.config = vim.tbl_deep_extend(&#34;force&#34;, {}, default_config, cfg or {})

  -- Êèê‰æõ :SqlitFloatToggle Êåá‰ª§
  vim.api.nvim_create_user_command(&#34;SqlitFloatToggle&#34;, function()
    M.toggle()
  end, {})

  -- Ë¶ñÁ™óÂ∞∫ÂØ∏ËÆäÊõ¥ÊôÇËá™Âãï resize
  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(&#34;VimResized&#34;, {
    callback = function()
      if is_valid_win(state.win) then
        vim.api.nvim_win_set_config(state.win, calc_win_config())
      end
    end,
  })
end

return M
